values:
I was riding on a jeepney one day and I was seated beside a teener (not older than 16) who was gushing over a book with an interesting cover. It was that of a set of handss holding an  apple. I searched through the internet for this book and lo and behold, i discovered Twilight.

This is the official summary of the Twilight movie: 

"  TWILIGHT is an action-packed, modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) has always been a little bit different, never caring about fitting in with the trendy girls at her Phoenix high school. When her mother re-marries and sends Bella to live with her father in the rainy little town of Forks, Washington, she doesn't expect much of anything to change. Then she meets the mysterious and dazzlingly beautiful Edward Cullen (Robert Pattinson), a boy unlike any she's ever met. Edward is a vampire, but he doesn't have fangs and his family is unique in that they choose not to drink human blood. Intelligent and witty, Edward sees straight into Bella's soul. Soon, they are swept up in a passionate, thrilling and unorthodox romance. To Edward, Bella is what he has waited 90 years for – a soul mate. But the closer they get, the more Edward must struggle to resist the primal pull of her scent, which could send him into an uncontrollable frenzy. But what will Edward & Bella do when a clan of new vampires – James (Cam Gigandet), Laurent (Edi Gathegi) and Victoria (Rachelle Lefevre) – come to town and threaten to disrupt their way of life? "  --© Summit

It's been a month (or two) since I stumbled upon this vampire romance saga and I have influenced most of my colleagues at work! We were all hooked (well, the girls were). There was even a time when we would send "Fanpire Quotes" everyday! We have also downloaded Book 5: Midnight Sun because we have already finished all of the 4 books of the series! Too bad Stephenie Meyer is holding the release of Midnight Sun because of piracy issues...

Our Annual Team Kris Kringle is on! Yeah!
Every Monday of every week, we will create an Alias for  ourselves.
And then on Friday of that week, we exchange gifts based on the week's theme.

For this week, our aliases are all "European Cities",
and the gifts' theme would be "Something Shiny".
Amount bracket is Php 50-200.
The gifts should be unisex though, because the gender is not indicated in the name.

Going to malls and choosing the perfect gift is the best part for me!
I love giving (and receiving) gifts!
I love Christmas!

I love you is not said in words.
















It is said in many different ways

without the use of words.

I love you is not said in 3 red roses.

It is said in a box of tissue,

when you've just had a fight

and the tears keep on flowing.

I love you is not said in a love letter.

It is said in a plain white mailing envelope

that you see in your mailbox every week.

I love you is not said in a box of chocolates.

It is said in a thoughtful gesture,

like a hug when you feel down.

I love you is not said in an engagement ring.

It is said in the holding of hands,

to assure you that you will never be alone.

I love you is not said in front of a priest.

It is said in front of God.

I love you is not a bunch of empty words.

It is a promise made for all eternity

to go beyond all mortality.

Im soo hooked on Gossip Girl on TV. Since I’m not able to watch it on Tuesdays on its regular timeslot, I watch the reruns every Saturday night instead. But no matter, I’m just a few days late in the loop.

 

Why do I like watching it?

 

For one, there are the clothes. You gotta admit, they are very trendy and sexy! Even Blair’s prim and proper fashion style is very chic! I also like Serena’s sense of style because it’s very wearable and can be duplicated with the kind of clothes that we have here in the country (sans the boots and scarves, of course!)

I also like the girls. Personally I like Blair's character more (i dont care what you say!). i  like her mean-ness, her bitchy-ness, and her beauty of course! I also like Serena because she's a very good friend. I also like Jenny because although she is "alila" to Blair, she's got spunk and she stands up for herself (at times, when needed).

 

Then there are the guys. I like all of the guy characters. There’s Chuck who’s every bit the Devil. I like that he’s so mischievous and naughty and has a lot of tricks up his sleeves, very much the Bad Boy from the upper class. Then there’s Nate, very good looking! He is the typical Good Boy who is trapped in his world brought about by his being born in it. And of course there is Dan. Personally I really like his character (because I know and dated some guys who are very much like him). He’s not that good looking, but he is street smart and is very articulate, very funny and somewhat a gentleman. And he loves his girl.

 

Probably the main reason why I like watching this show is because it reminds me sooo much of my high school days. Well, not the boarding school or sex or party-hardy part, but it reminds me of my rebellion and my flirting days back then. But the difference was, I was studying and flirting at the same time! (hahaha!)

The wait is over!


Today was the much anticipated 4-day Boracay trip of our team!
We booked the flight ages ago and now we are finally leaviing! Woohoo!

(Personally, I've been waiting for this trip because it's a step towards the completion of my 2008 Personal Goal - see previous post). 
 
I was confused (and amused) when I got to the airport (it was my first time there!) because of all the security measures I had to go through. The others were all making fun of me before and during the plane ride becasue it was my first time and i was sooo nervous when the plane took off and landed (those were the scariest parts for me).

I was in awe when we got to the beach, it was spectacular! I cant remember the last time I have been near one, so it was really a great experience. We went island hopping, snorkeling (they did, i didn't), sailing, and of course, bar and party hopping! We also enjoyed the food and the drinks (c/o Jona's), Jam's family's rented  house near Friday's resort, and endless hours in the sand.Ü

Here are some pics from that one unforgettable summer.
We vowed that this will be an annual summer outing for the team. Yey!

Someone correctly guessed that I am going through a difficult situation right now.
I was told  that I need to reassess myself and where I am at this point in my life. 
I was told that I need to think things over before I do any major decisions again.

I am leaving for Boracay in a few hours.. I guess this vacation came at the right time for me to reassess my current situation.. to reconcile my past with the present and the future.. this vacation was intended to be a milestone for a couple that has now gone their separate ways. but now, i am to go there alone but with some friends.

I promised myself that I will spend a part of my time in Boracay for my thoughts.
I also promised that I will be leaving everything behind there- my worries, my doubts, all questions left unanswered.
I promised to return to Manila with a fresh start and be positive from then on.
I promised to find myself.

I promise there will be no turning back for me when I return.
Only moving on. Forward.

Knew the signs, wasn't right
I was stupid for a while
Swept away by you and now I feel like a fool
So confused, my heart's bruised
Was I ever loved by you?

Out of reach, so far
I never had your heart
Out of reach, couldn't see
We were never meant to be

Catch myself  from despair
I could drown if I stay here
Keeping busy everyday
I know I will be OK

But I was so confused,
My heart's bruised
Was I ever loved by you?

Out of reach, so far
I never had your heart
Out of reach, couldn't see
We were never meant to be

So much hurt, so much pain
Takes a while to regain what is lost inside
And I hope that in time, you'll be out of my mind
And I'll be over you

But now I'm so confused,
My heart's bruised
Was I ever loved by you?

Out of reach, so far
I never had your heart
Out of reach, couldn't see
We were never meant to be

Out of reach, so far
You never gave your heart
In my reach, I can see
There's a life out there for me

I am an actress. 

You see, the whole point of an acting career is to get the attention of your audience.
You are an effective actress if you are able to engage your audience so that they react on the right cue.
You are also effective if you can engage your audience for the whole duration of your performance.

For more than three years now, I've portrayed several roles in my relationship.
The Bitch. The Sweet and Thoughtful. The Paranoid. The Mabait and Innocent. 
But I think I'm no good, because I can't get the attention of my lone audience: my BF. 

Yep.
Funny enough, he seemed to have the gist of my "performance" even before I start acting!
He knows where the storyline will lead and avoid the ending as much as possible (for there is only one ending in all of my plays: it's always tragic and confrontational.)

And so I'm running out of storylines to sustain my performances. Pretty soon, my stage/theater will be closing.
And I will be an actress without a stage.
Without an audience.

I don't have a Valentine's Date today..
for the third time in a row..


i guess i just have to start counting how many V-date i HAVEN'T HAD.. 
Maybe that would be easier...

If a man wants you, nothing can keep him away. If he doesn't want you, nothing can make him stay.

Stop making excuses for a man and his behavior. Allow your intuition (or spirit) to save you from heartache.

Stop trying to change yourself for a relationship that's not meant to be. Slower is better. Never live your life for a man before you find what makes you truly happy.

If a relationship ends because the man was not treating you as you deserve then heck no, you can't "be friends". A friend wouldn't mistreat a friend. Don't settle. If you feel like he is stringing you along, then he probably is. Don't stay because you think "it will get better." You'll be mad at yourself a year later for staying when things are not better.

The only person you can control in a relationship is you. Avoid men who've got a bunch of children by a bunch of different women. He didn't marry them when he got them pregnant, why would he treat you any differently?

Always have your own set of friends separate from his.
Maintain boundaries in how a guy treats you.

If something bothers you, speak up. Never let a man know everything. He will use it against you later.

You cannot change a man's behavior. Change comes from within. Don't EVER make him feel he is more important than you are...even if he has more education or in a better job.

Do not make him into a quasi-god. He is a man, nothing more nothing less. Never let a man define who you are.

Never borrow someone else's man. If he cheated with her, he'll cheat on you.

A man will only treat you the way you ALLOW him to treat you. All men are NOT dogs.

You should not be the one doing all the ending.. Compromise is a two way street. You need time to heal between relationships..
There is nothing cute about baggage..

Deal with your issues before pursuing a new relationship. You should never look for someone to COMPLETE you... a relationship consists of two WHOLE individuals... look for someone complimentary...not supplementary. 

Dating is fun...even if he doesn't turn out to be Mr. Right. Make him miss you sometimes... when a man always know where you are and you're always readily available to him - he takes it for granted.

Never move into his mother's house. Never co-sign for a man. Don't fully commit to a man who doesn't give you everything that you need.

Share this with other women and men (just so they know)...You'll make someone smile, another rethink her choices, and another woman prepare....

(borrowed form Chicken Soup for the Couple's Soul)

Every night, by the time you climb into bed, the day has generally taken such a bite out of both of you that the chances of feeling loving and affectionate  can be pretty remote. Thus, there should  be a rule: No discussing "Things We Have To Do" or "Unpleasant Business" once we get into bed.

                  See, you don't want to drag the world into bed with you, because there's enough going on there already. Beds are complex, multipurpose arenas, and it's important that the two parties specify which activity they're undertaking.
                  
                                     Are we talking, or are we reading?
                                     Are we sleeping, or are we fooling around?
                                     You have to clarify.
                                     Are we not talking because we're mad, or because we both just don't feel like talking?

                  The good thing is, when you're together forever, there's less pressure to make any given night magical. You always know you have another shot tomorrow. And the next night.

                  That's the whole beauty of Forever - nothing but tomorrows.

                  Of course, if you cash in the Tomorrow Chip too often, you break the bank. One day you roll over, notice each other, and say, "Hey, we used to do something here involving rubbing and touching - any idea what it was? No recollection at all? Hmm... I know I enjoyed it, I remember that."

                  So you negotiate, you clarify, and settle in. You find your position, you fix your pillows, and arrange your mutual blanket.

                  That blanket, essentially, is your relationship: one big cover concealing the fact that two people are inside, squirming around each other trying to get comfortable.

                  How you handle that blanket is crucial.

                  Sometimes you wake up and you have no blanket. There's nothing there to handle. The man of your dreams, who is sleeping very cozily, has somehow accumulated the bulk of what's at least half yours.

                  So you tug at it gingerly. He stirs, and seemingly unaware, he tightens his grasp and rolls farther away, taking with him another good foot and a half of blanket. You watch him and calculate your options. You decide it's not worth waking him up or being spiteful, so you try to make do without.

                  So you stare a t the ceiling and count the little paint bumps, hoping you can bore yourself back to sleep. Within seconds, your brain comes up with five different parts of the house that need painting and fixing.

                  Now you're more irritated and much more awake. You look over and see him dreaming blissfully, secure, cradled and warmed by what is now over 90% of the blanket. Despite your affection, you resent him deeply.

                  You sit up. You watch him sleep. You think to yourself, " How can this be? After all the negotiating and maneuvering and tap dancing we've done, how is it that this person, who, by your own initiative, will be placing his head 12 inches away from  your head for the rest of  your life, is getting such a better end of the bargain? It just doeesn't seem right. Will you never get better at this? Must one of you always be less content than the other? "

                  You pull up the pathetically small segment of blannket left available to you and scoot up next to the man of your dreams, partly because you hope that his sleep will rub off on you, and partly because you figure s/he's got to be warmer than you are.

                  And as you hold him close, it dawns on you: Now you remember. This is why you go through all that. Because holding The One Who Fits in your arms simply feels this good, and nothing else really does. And to earn this, you must swat away all that stands in its way.

                  At this point, your partner must have sensed you staring  and opens one eye.
                       
                                     " What? "
                                     " What do you mean 'what'? "
                                     " What are you doing? "
                                     " Nothing. "
                                     " What are you looking at me for? "
                                     " I wasn't looking... I was just thinking.. Are  you really going to be right there every night? "
                                     " Yes. "
                                     " Forever? "
                                     " Uh huh. "
                                     " You're saying, that of all the people in the world, the one to whoom you will donate your Naked
                                       Self, night after night, is ME? "
                                     " Yep. "

                    And he slides toward you, and you both find homes for your arms and legs. Before long, you're both sleeping.

                    And in the morning, the dance continues.

Happy 2008 everybody!

Aaahh... The New Year is upon us.
As always, people are up and about in making their own New Year's Resolutions.
Here's my take on this age-old tradition.

FOR MY HEALTH:
I will swim in the pool at least once a week.
I will be doing a 15-minute exercise everytime I wake up.
I will drink 1 glass of water every 3 hours.

FOR MY WEALTH:
Everytime I get my salary, I'll stash P500 for my savings,
another P500 for my future trips,
and P500 for my electronic gadgets.
All excess money from previous salary will be divided accordingly to the 3 priorities above.
I will not be too KURIPOT when it comes to myself.

OTHER THINGS I WANT TO ACCOMPLISH THIS YEAR:
I will go to at least three (3) vacation trips.
I will get promoted (?)
Learn a new language (either French or Mandarin)

FOR MY RELATIONSHIPS:
I will not be too busy for quality time with BF.
I will go out with BF at least twice a week.

I got up early today to go to work .
While I was in the shower, my mom knocked on the bathroom door and called me.
She said there was a guy outside the house who left a box of chocolates for me.
She said the guy's name was Kevin..

I  remembered Kevin.
He was the boy I shared the tricycle with last Saturday when I went home. I think he was also in the same shuttle I was riding from Glorietta going home.
I was actually a bit wary when he tried to talk to me in the tricycle, because I never talk to anyone and also because I am fairly new in the subdivision.
But I was polite towards him because he was nice naman. He gave his name, and so did I.
And I thought that was the end of it.

And now this box of chocolates.
My mom was bugging me for information about this boy. So I told her about what I knew about him.
Incidentally, my dad saw him too when he dropped off the chocolates.
I was impressed with the way my dad reacted. He just made a comment (a positive one, that is) and then the subject was dropped. No nagging, no inquiries.

There was a small card attached to the chocs wishing me a Merry Christmas, followed by his cellphone number.
As a courtesy, I texted him and said thank  you..

And he texted.. and texted. and texted back...

I told BF about him, but he wasn't bothered (read: not jealous) by the presence of this boy.
So I guess I have nothing to worry about, right?
We can be friends.

My colleague popped a CD in our CD player here in the office, and the first song was Seasons of Love from the musical "Rent". 

First thought that came to my mind:
Oh. My. God.
That's Mica's song!

Mica is my friend from my previous work, and we clicked from the first day of training. Just like that.
She sang this song as a consequence for breaking a rule or a request from the group for her to sing (I can't remember the situation exactly).
Being the beautiful and poised Mica that she was, we didn't expect her to sing that song! Personally, I thought she'll sing something of Celine Dion's or something diva-ish!

But no, she sang Seasons of Love.  She goes:

525,600 minutes, 525,000 moments so dear. 525,600 minutes - how do you measure,
measure a year? In daylights, in sunsets, in midnights, in cups of coffee. In
inches, in miles, in laughter, in strife. In 525,600 minutes - how do you
measure a year in the life?
How about love? How about love? How about love? Measure in love. Seasons of
love.

And it became HER song in the team. It was our own little joke for her.
And hearing that song just now made me miss her. We used to do a lot of things together: eat, work, watch TV, have fun, gossip, etc. etc. But now that we have gone our separate ways in search of a more fulfilling job, we barely had time to catch up (except for the occasional text messages).

Here's to you Mics!
Counting the 525,600 minutes 'til we see each other again..

I got this forwarded email of a list of christmas bazaars around the metro. Since I didn't have to work overtime today, I decided to go on a shopping trip!

TIME: 11:00 AM
PLACE: Christmas Bazaar @ Sanctuario de San Antonio, Forbes Park

I got there early and the sellers have just finished setting up their merchandise. They set up the tent in the garden/open space beside the church. There were shoes, bags, dresses/shirts, pampering kits, accessories, and loads of other stuff!

I bought some baby jumpers for the baby in our house ( it was so cheap and there were a lot of designs to choose from). I also saw these beautiful shoes from Ichigo (ichigo.multiply.com), but they didnt have my size (soo frustrating!). There were also cute bangles made by Bangles & Baubbles (they have been featured in some magazine shows recently).  The pampering kits were composed of bath gels/scrubs, body splash, and lotion and it's very affordable as a Christmas giveaway!

Suffice is to say, I haven't bought anything for me in that bazaar. But it was worth the trip there.

TIME: 1:00 PM
PLACE: Bonifacio High Street, Bonifacio Global City, Taguig

Now, this is the place I've been passing by quite a few times already but I didn't know exactly what it was. From the street, I thought it was just a bunch of office building/condo unit. But when I went inside, it was shopping haven! It was like the Philippine version of Rodeo Drive/Beverly Hills! The stores were an imposing and grand site, and it was such a clean architecture! The outside of it is like a park with a big area of grass, fountain, and benches. And since the place is such a Rodeo Drive-ish place, the prices are also skyrocketing! Its stores are A-list stores, even the restaurants. I looked around some of the stores (but I didn't dare touch the merchandise or even so much as look at the price tags!).



TIME: 1:30 PM
PLACE: Serendra, The Fort, Taguig

I crossed the street from Bonifacio High Street and lo and behold, I was in Serendra! I didn't know that I have been passing by this area so many times and didn't know what it was! I thought it was a row of Condo Units, but it was a shopping area pala! And this place has such a Spanish-style feel and ambiance. It has a nice landscape and the buildings/stores are so close together it was soo cozy to look at! And I saw there Cupcakes by Sonja which my officemates were soo crazy about! So I bought some, and it was really good! It was velvety soft, and soo sweet! The restaurants were not your ordinary dining destiantion, but the ambiance will surely make you try their food. I would definitely go back there, not for shopping, but for dining and enjoy the ambiance (with the BF, of course!).



TIME: 2:00PM
PLACE: Market! Market!, The Fort, Taguig

This is where my budget fits! Hahaha! I can go malling here with my eyes closed, but the only place I visit there is the Fashion Market! because they have a wide selections of clothes there, not to mention CHEAP! Also, I went there because the tiangge that I frequent in G2 (which sadly was included in the Glorietta Blast recently) has their only other outlet in Market! Market! I bought this beautiful and colorful dress that I saw from the G2 store (I was fortunate that they had the same dress there!) I also bought some everyday shirts.


I met up with BF after my shopping trip and then we went home not long after. It was soo nice to have a shopping trip on my own. I enjoyed being alone while shoppping, I was able to gush about the things I can't buy, to marvel at the stores (and the prices!), and to just feel relaxed while walking and window shopping. I know guys wouldn't understand it, but it really is a therapy for girls when they go shopping.

There's a new craze in the office today, it's PeterAnswers' site!

When you go to this particular site, you can type in ANY question and he will answer it correctly! Well, he will not answer you all the time but it's amazing when he does because it turns out to be correct!

Seriously guys, you have to try it.

It's supposed to be a long vacation from Nov 1 - 4, 2007, but I wasn't able to enjoy it.
Because I just stayed home and bored myself to death.

Well, I did go out for a couple of hours on Saturday with the BF, but other than that I was at home the rest of the vacation. It was sooo boring!

I cant wait to get back to work, seriously!

It's Halloween!
And it's my first time to get into the bandwagon of dressing up and giving candies. I'm such a kid!

Anyway, so I was dressed up as a Fairy Princess (wings and all). erna was also in costume as an Angel, Nards was a Zombie, MJ was a mobster, Catoy was the policeman, Jam was Wednesday Adams, Mai was a Mosquito (kidding!), and Kevin was Salbakuta (wahaha!)

Maurice did my makeup and he was soo proud of it ( thanks Mau!). Aside from the costumes, we also had a Frightfest where we showed horror/thriller/suspense  movies in our Lobby Area. We also had a Halloween potluck (for lunch) and it was soo yummy! Kris made leche flan for all of us (bless her!), MJ made tortang talong, Catoy brought her famous Lechon Kawali, and Maureen brought fresh Lumpia. Everyone was full and satisfied by the time we finished (slurp!).

after that we went to the other floors of the company to make the rounds for the Trick or Treat! we say a lot of cute kids all asking for goodies! We ourselves also got some candies from those who willingly gave (shempre, kasi cute kami eh!)

It was so much fun, mainly because it was the first time I did that ever!
Looking forward to next year's event!

What a day!

It has been a busy day at the office. Lots of applicants came in and the new testing procedure of the hiring department is sooo tedious I had to administer it one at a time.. And then there's the on-going Audit which I really needed to focus on, updates for some daily reports at the end of the day..

But it's all okay because I have something to look forward to at the end of the week...

                                              

                           The whole team will be spending the holiday in SUBIC!

 Of course there will be a time for work (we'll have planning sessions for about 3 hours), but other than that, we're free to roam around and par-tay! hooray!!!

This is the first time in a long while that I'll be going out of town (for leisure/work) and Im super excited!! I'm going to enjoy every minute of it!! (remind me to bring my digicam so I can post pics here)

But before that, I have to finish my work til Thursday so that I wont have to think of other things while Im supposed to be having fun..

I'll write about Subic when  I get back.

We had a Saturday OT today (surprise surprise!) and I got in early, but Erna and Nards were already there before me. 

And so I started with my normal routine at the ofice. I put a VCD on our player (I brought Music & Lyrics with me), made a hot chocolate drink  and ate bread from the convenience store. And then I started to work.
Then the others started to come in: MJ, Kris, Jam, Maila and her baby Bianca. 

By lunchtime, everybody was hungry already. MJ and Jam decided to go to Salcedo Park to grab something to eat. We didn't know what or where it was but we went all the same..

Lo and behold! It was like a sosyal outdoor market! It was like an empty parking lot in Salcedo with dozens of tents built side by side. There was a variety of food: pastries, kakanin, fish (either fresh or cooked), and viands that were either grilled, or laid out catering style..  Aside from that, there were also plants sold, and souvenirs! 



And the people! It was like Expat Heaven! There were a lot of people of different races there and it seemed that they were not bothered by the heat and the smell (because there were grill stands there) of the place! It was actually pretty amazing!



And so after we have gone back to the office to eat (we had our food to go), it was time to go home. As I was preparing (since I didn't have anywhere to go to after work, no DATE!), Jam and Maila asked me if I wanted to go with them to Mamplasan (in Laguna), coz MJ wanted to go there. Of course I would! I've heard about the place and I wanted to check it out for myself. I've heard it's like a depot for Class A Sports Apparel (shoes, shirts, jackets, etc). 

So off we go! We had a few problems on the road because we didn't know where to exit in Laguna.. hehehe.. When we got there, it was a small warehouse lang pala. They were selling Nike, Adidas, New Balance, Speedo, Sketchers, etc. It was old stocks, but the price is a little cheaper than that of an item on sale in the malls. MJ bought shoes for her mom but the rest of us just looked around (and we didn't take that long because the place is small lang naman).

We were on the road again after about 30-45 minutes, this time going home na. But then we got hungry and we stopped by a gas station with a KFC and Starbucks on the side to grab a quick bite. The KFC there was soo funny because they have a window there that says "WALK-THRU" (drive-thru, walk-thru, get it?). Why couldn't the customers just go inside and order instead of going to the WALK-THRU? Isn't it just the same?! hahaha!

Bianca (Mai's baby) was making funny jokes on the car and that made the trip worthwhile. She goes:


                 
                                 Bianca: Tita Jam, lahat ng sasabihin ko lagyan mo ng "e ko" ha?
                                 Jam: Ok go!
                                 Bianca: Apple!
                                 Jam: Apple-e ko!
                                 Bianca: Orange
                                 Jam: Orange- e ko!
                                 Bianca: Nata!
                                 Jam: I dont want to say it! Wahaha!

And that's my day out.

Last night, on a whim, the whole team went to Cena in Greenbelt to unwind.

We badly needed this break from work because we have been auditing employee files for about a month already. And I think we have had about enough for now, so we went out.

And so there we were. The place was really pretty. It was my first time to actually sit there and drink/eat, but I do pass by the place almost everyday and I thought it was a bit pricey. But it wasn't. The place was full of beautiful people (including us!), there was an acoustic band/trio playing for the guests and the mood/ambiance was just relaxed.

And so we ordered our drinks, some of us ate (I didn't, because I just came from a birthday celebration in the office), and we took pictures. Lots and lots of pictures! hehe..

It was a great way to cap the night. We were laughing, we talked about other things besides WORK, we planned our team building for this month (I'll write about it when it happens), etc etc. I enjoyed every moment of it because it has been a long time since I spent the night out (either with colleagues or my significant other). 

I hope we can do it again!!!

It's now official.
I'm single and back in the dating game.

And so it begins.

Today is a new day.
Im turning a new leaf, a fresh start.

Today marked the 3rd year of my relationship with my boyfriend.
And it was just any other ordinary day.

We didn't see each other.
There was no midnight call/text to greet each other.
There was no breakfast/lunch/dinner to celebrate the occasion.
Shit.

I should have guessed, because we have been on a silent war since last week. But of course being the girl that I am, I was expecting a little (ok, a lot!). I was thinking maybe he'll surprise me and come into the office and invite me to dinner. Or at the very least he would call to greet me and we'll kiss and makeup. But I was surprised that there was no gesture made. 

We're not exactly fighting, it was like I was ignoring him for missing a gathering that I really wanted to attend with him. And after that, well I realized some things that made me second guess the relationship. Like what, you ask? Like:

1) We've never been to ANY party together. The one time he went with me to a christening, he didn't even make any effort to mingle with my friends. I, on the other hand, has never been invited to ANY of his parties. Ever.
2) Of the 3 years that we've been together, I've only seen his cellphone twice or thrice. I take it it's either he doesn't trust me or that he has messages there he doesn't want me to know about.
3) I've only met his parents twice; once was on a family dinner at Max's that I stumbled upon (I was not really invited, but since I was there already, it's the only polite thing to do), and the other was for the blessing of his brother's house.
4) He has never given me a duplicate of the keys to his condo (eventhough he knows that I need a place to stay whenever I have OT in the office).
5) It took 2 years before I knew about his greatest secret, of which he didnt have any intention of telling me and of which I obtained painfully (but it paid of eventually)
5) In the 3 years that we have been together, he only gave me 1 gift, of which hiningi ko pa.

And lastly, which is for me has the greatest weight of all: there have been no talks of a future together. He has his own plans of going abroad (alone), of saving money for HIS condo, for HIS own future business, etc etc. Never once did he ask me to come with him abroad or share his plans. I've never been included. And he actually defended it to me, and I didn't say anything because I didnt want to argue about it anymore.

And that's what Im doing now, Im ignoring the pain it's causing me. Im just stepping back and assessing the whole relationship. Siguro Im tired na rin of hoping that I will be included in his plans. Would anyone want to stay in a relationship that thrives in the present only? Can you honestly tell me that you'll stay in a relationship where your partner doesn't see you as a partner for life? I mean, isn't that the point of a relationship, so that you can see if s/he is the one you'll want to spend your life with?

Siguro Im tired na rin of not feeling that we are in sync, or of trying too hard to be in sync with him. A person can only do so much for the one s/he loves. Im not being ingrata, I do appreciate the things he has done but it is outweighed by the things that are missing.

Of the 3 years we've been together, its like im floating into nothingness. I feel like I don't know where I stand (because there is no future waiting for me with this guy); I feel like there's nothing left for me to give; I feel that I dont deserve not being cared for in the way that I wanted to.

And I feel that I only have enough strength left to leave. Right now.
Before I get crushed all the more.

My officemate introduced me to Kyle. He brought him along to a party and I was hooked on him eversince. Funny thing was, he's weird. I mean he doesn't have a belly button! And he is like a teenage baby!! but he is sooo gorgeous!

Okay so Im dreaming here. Im talking about Kyle XY, a TV series shown every Wednesday night on Studio 23. Kyle is THE cutest teenage actor ever (never mind that his sexual preference is a matter of dispute, as listed in the Net when I searched in Google). And he acts his role (which is of an innocent teenage boy testing everything for the first time) very convincingly.

Once you get past the gorgeous face that is Kyle, you'll also appreciate the story. I know it's kinda Smallville-ish, but it''s a bit different. From what I gather, it seems that Kyle is like a science experiment-gone-wrong, a "lab rat" for brain/memory/ability testing, and he was disposed off (but not properly). And so his story in the real world of people begins.

Anyway, Im soo hooked on him now that I go home early after work to watch him on TV (we also have the DVD at work so I see him almost 24/7). Im totally crushing on him.

Too bad he's gay.

It has been a long time since I accessed my Friendster account. There was nothing much there, just some messages from my friends on my birthday (which was soo 3 weeks ago). I've added my officemates in my Friends list. Checked out some people, their whereabouts and all that. Pretty much that's it.

I've never appreciated much the role of my friends in my life. I mean, I love them and all, but now I see them very rarely (and on those rare occasions we all had beers in our hands and tsismis on our lips). I appreciate them now because I miss them, soo much! I miss the chismis, the laughter, the makeup sessions and movie marathons we used to have before. Now that we have our own jobs (some have families already), we don't spend that much time anymore.

Friends, to me, is like a much needed massage after a long day at work. Or like ice cream or sweets that makes my meal complete. Or just like a smile on my face. Something like that.

Anyway, so now I realize I badly need to see my friends. Actually I called one of my closest college buddy yesterday, and it was enough to brighten my day afterwards. Suffice is to say that I missed him. So as part of my action plan for completion this year of my life, I swear I will meet up with at least ONE friend in a week. That shouldn't be too hard, should it?

Just to make me sane.

There was a birthday celebration @ the office today, and I was invited! Woohoo!
                  The food was great (I ate a lot!), and I even had a balloon French Poodle!
